title: American_Top_40_1981_January_10th
description:
American Top 40 with Casey Kasem aired on radio from July 4, 1970 until August 6, 1988. This rebroadcast is one of many I have recorded from internet radio. A few are incomplete but most are not and I hope you enjoy these as much as I do.

In this first broadcast of 1981 broadcast:

John Lennon died a tragic death just thirty-two days before this broadcast. His song, "Starting Over" went to number one shortly after and remains at number one this week in 1981.

Casey answers the question, "In the rock era, what song has zigged and zagged the most in its time on the chart?"

Casey tells of the band that Ed Sullivan paid $10,000 NOT to appear on his show.

Casey answers the question, "Which day of the week has been mentioned in the most top 40 song titles."

One singer in the countdown says she won't listen to any music by Diana Ross or Barbra Streisand. Casey explains why.
